title: Midseason Ratings Report Card: NBC’s Most- and Least-Watched Shows
description: Now that your broadcast-TV favorites are on holiday break, TVLine is looking at how each network’s shows are stacking up thus far in the 2024-25 TV season. Having already crunched the numbers for ABC, CBS, Fox and even The CW, today we close things out with NBC. Listed below is the average TOTAL AUDIENCE for each NBC series (including […]
author: Matt Webb Mitovich
excerpt: NBC's midseason ratings report card is here, led by football... the mighty #OneChicago trifecta... and #TheVoice.
text: Midseason Ratings Report Card: NBC’s Most- and Least-Watched ShowsNow that your broadcast-TV favorites are on holiday break, TVLine is looking at how each network’s shows are stacking up thus far in the 2024-25 TV season. Having already crunched the numbers for ABC, CBS, Fox and even The CW, today we close things out with NBC. ‘Chicago Fire,’ ‘Sunday Night Football’ and ‘Brilliant Minds’Courtesy of NBC Listed below is the average TOTAL AUDIENCE for each NBC series (including Live+7 delayed playback). Alongside that is the DEMO RATING (Adults 18-49) for each program, as well as any noteworthy PERFORMANCE NOTES. Each program’s RANK represents how it is faring in total audience compared to other shows on NBC. NBC (FALL 2024)TOTAL VIEWERSDEMO RATINGPERFORMANCE NOTES1Sunday Night Football18.6 million4.8TV’s most-watched program; audience down just 6% YOY, demo is steady2Chicago Fire7.8 million0.61NBC’s #1-rated non-sports program; broadcast’s #4-rated drama; audience -8% vs. last season3Chicago Med7.4 million0.57Smallest audience gap with Fire in four seasons!4Chicago P.D.6.9 million0.60Audience -11% vs. last season, and retention out of Fire is down 2%5The Voice (Monday)6.5 million0.54TV’s most-watched reality program; numbers up vs. 2023-24 season6The Voice (Tuesday)5.8 million0.487Law & Order: SVU5.6 million0.65Broadcast’s #2-rated drama (TIE); audience -18% vs. last season8Brilliant Minds4.94 million0.38Up 29% in audience/steady in demo vs. The Voice‘s spring lead-out (Deal or No Deal Island)9The Irrational4.87 million0.39Audience down 17% on new night, but +9% vs. time slot predecessor Found10Law & Order4.83 million0.45Audience down 16% vs last season11Happy’s Place4.7 million0.40Doubled time slot predecessor Lopez vs. Lopez‘s S2 audience, also improved on demo12Found3.9 million0.41Audience down 13% on new night; numbers -23% and -33% from time slot predecessor Organized Crime13St. Denis Medical3.6 million0.44Numbers on par with Night Court Season 2 in Tuesday lead-off spot14B1G Saturday Night Football3.3 million0.7015Dateline NBC3.2 million0.36Down just a tick in viewers16Night Court2.9 million0.33Audience -24% in later slot; numbers also down from time slot predecessor Extended Family17Lopez vs. Lopez2.3 million0.26Numbers rock-steady vs. Season 2, and yet: NBC’s least-watched, lowest-rated program THE TVLINE BOTTOM LINE: Sunday Night Football of course remains the crown jewel in the ratings game, while The Voice continues to sing as TV’s most-watched reality program. #OneChicago adds up to three of network-TV’s Top 10 most-watched and top-rated dramas, a feat only bested by CBS. Among NBC’s schedule changes, Brilliant Minds, The Irrational and Happy’s Place all improved their time slots, whereas the Organized Crime-replacing Found… did not. In fact, CBS’ robust Matlock/Elsbeth combo, coupled with ABC’s own Doctor Odyssey/Grey’s Anatomy upgrade, appears to be costing viewers for both Found and its lead-in SVU. Lastly, no one can be laughing at that Night Court decline — time to return it to Tuesday’s lead-off spot? Which of NBC’s rankings most surprises or pleases you? Want SCOOP on any of the NBC shows above? Email InsideLine@tvline.com and your question may be answered via Matt’s Inside Line!
html:
Midseason Ratings Report Card: NBC’s Most- and Least-Watched Shows

Now that your broadcast-TV favorites are on holiday break, TVLine is looking at how each network’s shows are stacking up thus far in the 2024-25 TV season. Having already crunched the numbers for ABC, CBS, Fox and even The CW, today we close things out with NBC.

Listed below is the average TOTAL AUDIENCE for each NBC series (including Live+7 delayed playback). Alongside that is the DEMO RATING (Adults 18-49) for each program, as well as any noteworthy PERFORMANCE NOTES.

Each program’s RANK represents how it is faring in total audience compared to other shows on NBC.

THE TVLINE BOTTOM LINE: Sunday Night Football of course remains the crown jewel in the ratings game, while The Voice continues to sing as TV’s most-watched reality program. #OneChicago adds up to three of network-TV’s Top 10 most-watched and top-rated dramas, a feat only bested by CBS. Among NBC’s schedule changes, Brilliant Minds, The Irrational and Happy’s Place all improved their time slots, whereas the Organized Crime-replacing Found… did not. In fact, CBS’ robust Matlock/Elsbeth combo, coupled with ABC’s own Doctor Odyssey/Grey’s Anatomy upgrade, appears to be costing viewers for both Found and its lead-in SVU. Lastly, no one can be laughing at that Night Court decline — time to return it to Tuesday’s lead-off spot?

Which of NBC’s rankings most surprises or pleases you?

Want SCOOP on any of the NBC shows above? Email InsideLine@tvline.com and your question may be answered via Matt’s Inside Line!
